issue.title: Fixed #1860
issue.body: SimpleXMLElement will trigger E_WARNING error messages if XML strings to be compared are not well-formed.

body:
I think  a15d638 brakes xml comparsion (phpunit 4.8.8):

now two xml's indented differently are not equal.

Testing these 2 HTML outputs will fail: ``` html Bootstrap 101 Template

Hello, world!

``` ``` html Bootstrap 101 Template

Hello, world!

``` Here is the weird result: ``` Failed asserting that two DOM documents are equal. --- Expected +++ Actual @@ @@ Bootstrap 101 Template +

Hello, world!

-
@ambroisemaupate Please open a new ticket if there is another regression (something that worked in 4.8.7 but does not in 4.8.9).
@sebastianbergmann My bad, I’m still on _4.8.8_. Version _4.8.9_ is not available yet on https://packagist.org/packages/phpunit/phpunit as stable release.
PHPUnit 4.8.9 was tagged yesterday. Weird that Packagist has not picked it up. I manually triggered an update now.
That’s all right now! Thanks for your help @sebastianbergmann.

issue.title: Arguments for an object within a listener cannot accept multiple same argument type since version 4.8
issue.body:
I used XML configuration file with listener declared as follow 

``` xml
    <listeners>
        <listener class="Bartlett\LoggerTestListener">
            <arguments>
                <object class="YourMonolog">
                    <arguments>
                        <string>PHPUnit</string>
                        <string>debug</string>
                    </arguments>
                </object>
            </arguments>
        </listener>
    </listeners>
```

My object `YourMonolog` class constructor (accept two arguments) signature is as follow : 

``` php
<?php

use Monolog\Logger;

class YourMonolog extends Logger
{
    public function __construct($name = 'PHPUnit', $level = 'debug')
    {
    }
}
```

With PHP 4.6.10 and 4.7.7 (latest versions or previous branches) I got no issues, and the XML conf was correctly interpreted, and transmit two arguments as wished.

With PHP 4.8.9 (no tried other 4.8.x), the XML is readed and interpreted as only one argument transmitted to listener with walue `PHPUnitdebug`

I got following errors

```
PHP Notice:  Trying to get property of non-object in phar://C:/UwAmp/bin/php/phar/phpunit-4.8.9.phar/phar/phpunit/Util/XML.php on line 224
PHP Stack trace:
PHP   1. {main}() C:\UwAmp\bin\php\phar\phpunit-4.8.9.phar:0
PHP   2. PHPUnit_TextUI_Command::main($exit = *uninitialized*) C:\UwAmp\bin\php\phar\phpunit-4.8.9.phar:547
PHP   3. PHPUnit_TextUI_Command->run($argv = array (0 => '\\UwAmp\\bin\\php\\phar\\phpunit-4.8.9.phar', 1 => '-c', 2 => 'examples\\phpunit.monolog.xml'), $exit = TRUE) phar://C:/UwAmp/bin/php/phar/phpunit-4.8.9.phar/phar/phpunit/TextUI/Command.php:100
PHP   4. PHPUnit_TextUI_TestRunner->doRun($suite = class PHPUnit_Framework_TestSuite { private $cachedNumTests = NULL; protected $backupGlobals = NULL; protected $backupStaticAttributes = NULL; private $disallowChangesToGlobalState = NULL; protected $runTestInSeparateProcess = FALSE; protected $name = 'Demo Test Suite'; protected $groups = array ('default' => array (...)); protected $tests = array (0 => class PHPUnit_Framework_TestSuite { ... }); protected $numTests = -1; protected $testCase = FALSE; protected $foundClasses = array (0 => 'Your\\Name_Space\\YourTestSuite'); private $iteratorFilter = NULL }, $arguments = array ('listGroups' => FALSE, 'loader' => NULL, 'useDefaultConfiguration' => TRUE, 'configuration' => 'examples\\phpunit.monolog.xml', 'testSuffixes' => array (0 => 'Test.php', 1 => '.phpt'))) phar://C:/UwAmp/bin/php/phar/phpunit-4.8.9.phar/phar/phpunit/TextUI/Command.php:148
